lines.text: Good afternoon, Miss Booth! Lovely day isn't it?
Kid stuff.
Good afternoon, Miss Booth! How are you today?
I'll never know.
Good afternoon! There's some mail on the drawing room table.
Very interesting
[sigh]
for tourists.
Good aftenoon, Miss! Will there be anyone for dinner, Miss Booth?
I expect to live and die a bachelor.
Well, let's go on inside. Maybe the coffins will cheer you up.
It's a fine world. Back in Carvel there are people waiting to laugh at my funeral. Here in New York they've got coffins to cheer me up.
Now don't you feel glad just to be alive?
I've never before really appreciated the advantage of being dead.
Why are some men so dumb?
You said a mouthful, toots!
Whenever I get disillusioned, I always get a pain in my stomach.
Betsy's a New Yorker, so of course she carries a gat.
We're not hillbillies. We wear shoes everyday.

[In reference to Ulysses S. Grant]
He didn't have trouble like I got, all he had on his hands was a civil war.
When a boy's stupid... he's just stupid, that's all.
New York's a sink of... well... well, it's a sink! I won't be safe there!

What has New York got that Carvel hasn't? Just a lot of tall buildings. And what do people do when they get in tall buildings? They jump out of windows, that's what they do. I tell you New York is a den of evil!
A guy's world comes crashing down around his shoulders and you offer him corn beef and cabbage!
